cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 715 miles (1150 km) east of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest toward the northern Leeward Islands, then turning northwest north of Puerto Rico toward the Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Leeward Islands (near Antigua and Barbuda)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Antigua and Barbuda; Tropical Storm Watch for Anguilla, Montserrat, St. Kitts, Nevis, Saba and St. Eustatius
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and Virgin Islands; Puerto Rico may experience peripheral tropical-storm-force winds and high surf
weather_observation.wind: Low (20%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) peaking late Saturday night into Sunday; hurricane-force winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible; seas mainly 1–2 ft above normal with dangerous rip currents.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher, mainly Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf, rip currents, and short-term visibility reductions in squalls may affect vessel operations.
